alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:16PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Randolph County through 345 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Union City, or 15 miles west of Greenville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Randolph County, including the following locations... Farmland, Saratoga, Lynn, Union City and Modoc. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
